subtitle: Eight-Organ Creative-Institutional System
system_summary: PRAXIS IN PROGRESS — 89 repos (all on GitHub), 82 PRODUCTION (100% of non-archived) + 7 ARCHIVED, 8 flagship repos (4 SUBSTANTIAL, 2 PARTIAL), 28 essays (~111K words), community health files across 8 orgs, POSSE distribution live, Jekyll site with RSS (28 essays), 82+ CI/CD workflows, Astro portfolio site scaffolded with 6 pages (landing, projects, essays, architecture, dashboard, about), 19 curated projects in gallery, 5 application packages generated (Knight Foundation, Processing Foundation, Eyebeam, Google Creative, AI systems roles), system-metrics.json dashboard with full PRAXIS target tracking, meta-README 3,000+ words, ~386K+ total words, aesthetic nervous system propagating taste.yaml across all organs, full provenance tracking (1,901 files classified).
strategic_context: Meta-system documentation (governance, orchestration, infrastructure) strengthens applications across: (1) AI systems engineering roles at research labs, (2) Creative/technical grants (NSF, NEA, Mellon, Knight Foundation), (3) Technology residencies and fellowships. This registry demonstrates orchestration capacity, architectural reasoning, and systemic sustainability—competitive differentiators in 2026 funding landscape.
supporting_evidence: Artists like Julian Oliver, Nicky Case, and Hundred Rabbits (Devine Lu Linvega & Rekka Bellum) treat protocols and governance structures as primary artistic output, demonstrating that small-scale sustainable creative infrastructure with extensive documentation receives institutional recognition (updated per 08-CANONICAL-ACTION-PLAN.md §7). Programs like Knight Foundation Art+Tech Expansion Fund, Processing Foundation Fellowship, Google Creative Fellowship explicitly evaluate infrastructure contribution and organizational capacity.
strategic_opportunity: Position the eight-organ system as evidence of: (a) production-ready thinking (hiring), (b) long-term digital capacity and sustainability (grants), (c) community contribution and reusable infrastructure (residencies). All organs launch simultaneously to demonstrate integrated systems thinking.

application_targets.description: Orchestration capacity, architectural reasoning, multi-agent systems
NSF, NEA, Mellon, Knight Foundation — infrastructure as art
Eyebeam, Recurse Center — equitable systems, community infrastructure
Processing Foundation, Google Creative — artist-engineer hybrid
